content:
Hi I'm a brand new Backdrop user, and really liking it very much. I'm using Backdrop to set up a site for our coalition to end private prisons in our state.

  • Right now partners are a bulleted list.
  • I'd like to include partner logos and names as nice neat boxes similar to what is shown in the triplo website.
  • I'm not sure how to do this.

Would someone be so kind as to point me in the right direction? Alternatively, if there's a better place to raise the question please point me to the right spot. Being new here, I'm not super clear on community norms. Sorry if I'm approaching this in a clumsy way.

Hi, Nathan Craig. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

@Nathan Craig - Feel free to ask questions here or anywhere. We're pretty flexible. However, I am going to ask if you would be willing to move your question to the forum. I prefer answer questions like this in the forum, because the answers are easier for other users to find in the future (and this is a good question).

https://forum.backdropcms.org/

Here is my short answer. If you have theming skills and are ok writing custom css, you can accomplish what you are attempting with a view and some custom theming. If you are trying to put your site together with modules and site-building, you should look at the Fanciblock module. https://backdropcms.org/project/fanciblock
@Nathan Craig Welcome! Just out of curiosity, have to come to Backdrop from Drupal, or are you a new CMS user?

As for your question, it looks like your bullet list is currently in the Body field of your page. If this is your only list of partners (i.e. you don't plan on having a different list on each page), my recommendation would be to setup a new content type (called 'Partner' for example) that has fields for the logo and link/URL. Then create new Partner content for each of your bullet points (and then remove them from the Body field). Once you have your Partners as separate content in a new content type, you can use the power of Views to output them in the method you desire (see @StPaulTim's comment above).
@Nathan Craig Glad you are here! Thanks for the work you and your coalition are doing. I agree, knowing more about your background and skill set would affect what I recommend in this case.
